description: Ms. leaf. Physical description: Written in medium naskh in black on beige glazed, laid Arabic paper. Text framed in blue and red; headings in red. Illuminations in gold and color. Origin: The paper quality, calligraphy, and measurements seem to correspond to the stipulations in the author's waqf (Blair, p. 14), which would indicated that this copy was produced in his scriptorium in Tabriz in the 14th century.
author: Rashīd al-Dīn Ṭabīb, 1247?-1318
abstract: Leaf from the Jāmiʻ al-tavārīkh. Contains mention of the Liang Dynasty (502-556) and Hsüan-ti, founder of the Late/Western Liang [Hou Liang],(555-562).
indexed by: Blair, S. A compendium of chronicles : Rashid al-Din's illustrated history of the world
extent: 1 leaf : paper, col. ill. ; 428 x 329 (341 x 231) mm.
title: [Leaf from the Jāmiʻ al-tavārīkh depicting seven Chinese emperors].
creator: رشىد الدىن طبىب، 1247?-1318
subject: China—Kings and rulers—History
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
